intro: Leucophysalis sinicum, commonly known as the Chinese golden bell, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Styracaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has opposite, simple, and ovate leaves with a smooth texture. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant flowers and autumn foliage coloration.
